item.title: The Thinking Behind the Notenik File Format
item.description: People have been storing notes in text files long before Notenik came along. So why is the Notenik format different?

item.title: Notenik for the Mac Versions 2.5.0 and 2.6.0 Released
item.description: Version 2.6.0 was focused on strengthening support for opening folders full of existing text files and handling them smoothly as Notenik Collections.

item.title: Notenik Project # 3: Create a To Do List
item.description: This post is the third in a series designed to gradually explain the use of Notenik for increasingly complex and sophisticated tasks. Today we're going to use this Mac app to create a To Do list.

item.title: Notenik for the Mac Version 2.4.0 Released
item.description: Most of the changes for this release were focused on providing the capability for wiki-like inter-note linking.

item.title: Notenik for the Mac Version 2.3.0 Released
item.description: Fixed treatment of the Teaser field, to treat it as a long text field; increased tolerance for Notes with alternative formatting; added Ink as an alternate for parsing of Markdown; added an optional Timestamp field, as a first step to enabling use of Notenik to create a Zettelkasten.

item.title: Notenik for the Mac Version 2.2.0 Released
item.description: Added Cut, Copy and Paste support for Notes; added support for British spelling of 'Favorites'; relocated Reload Collection command to the Collection menu to make it easier to find; suppressed empty tags from the Favorites to HTML export.

item.title: Notenik Project # 2: Create a Collection of Bookmarks
item.description: This post is the second in a series designed to gradually explain the use of Notenik for increasingly complex and sophisticated tasks. Today we're going to use this Mac app to create a Collection of Bookmarks that you can access from any of your web browsers.

item.title: Notenik Project # 1: Create a Simple Collection of Notes
item.description: This post is the first in a series designed to gradually explain the use of Notenik for increasingly complex and sophisticated tasks. Today we're going to use Notenik just to create a basic Collection of Notes about anything that might interest you.

item.title: Notenik: A Contrarian Mix of Old and New
item.description: Given my background as a programmer and long-time Mac user, it should probably come as no surprise that my first native Mac app is a sometimes surprising mix of old and new.

item.title: All Swift, All the Time
item.description: Moving on from Java, Notenik development is now all Swift, all the time.
